meanings.definition: Urge: to strongly encourage or persuade
meanings.sent1: Mom urges me to finish my homework before dinner.
meanings.sent2: I always urge my friends to try new foods.
meanings.sent3: The teacher's constant urging helped the students improve their grades.
meanings.sent4: The coach's urging pushed the team to victory.
meanings.sent5: The urgent plea from the charity organization spurred many to donate.

meanings.definition: Urge: a strong desire or impulse
meanings.sent1: His urge to explore new places led him on exciting adventures.
meanings.sent2: The urge to eat something sweet after dinner is hard to resist.
meanings.sent3: She felt the urge to dance when her favorite song came on.
meanings.sent4: The urge to help others is a noble trait.
meanings.sent5: The sudden urge to laugh during the serious meeting was hard to control.

meanings.definition: Urge: a sudden strong feeling or desire to do something
meanings.sent1: The urge to run away from the spider was overwhelming.
meanings.sent2: I had an urge to sing along with the catchy tune.
meanings.sent3: His urge to jump in the puddle was too tempting to resist.
meanings.sent4: The urge to check my phone every few minutes is hard to ignore.
meanings.sent5: The sudden urge to buy a new book struck me while browsing the bookstore.
